name: Differential Equations & Series
description: Exploring the use of calculus in solving equations that model real-world dynamic systems.

cards.title: First-Order Differential Equations
cards.description: Solving basic ordinary differential equations (ODEs) and understanding their applications.
bulletpoints: Recognize and classify first-order ODEs, including separable, linear, and exact equations.
Solve separable equations using integration: \[ \int \frac{dx}{x} = \int dt \Rightarrow x = Ce^t \]
Use the integrating factor method for linear ODEs: \[ y' + p(x)y = q(x) \Rightarrow \mu(x) y = \int \mu(x) q(x) dx \]
Apply first-order ODEs to population growth \( P' = rP \) and radioactive decay \( N' = -\lambda N \)

cards.title: Second-Order Differential Equations
cards.description: Solving second-order ODEs with constant coefficients.
bulletpoints: Solve homogeneous second-order ODEs using the characteristic equation: \[ ay'' + by' + cy = 0 \Rightarrow r^2 + br + c = 0 \]
Use undetermined coefficients for nonhomogeneous equations: \[ y_p = A e^{rx} + B e^{-rx} \]
Model harmonic motion and electrical circuits with equations like \[ m y'' + c y' + k y = F(t) \]

cards.title: Higher-Order Differential Equations
cards.description: Extending solution methods to third- and higher-order differential equations.
bulletpoints: Generalize characteristic equation solutions to higher-order ODEs: \[ a_n y^{(n)} + a_{n-1} y^{(n-1)} + ... + a_1 y' + a_0 y = 0 \]
Apply reduction of order for second solutions when one solution is known.
Model complex physical systems such as mechanical vibrations and wave propagation.

cards.title: Laplace Transforms & Differential Equations
cards.description: Using the Laplace transform to solve ODEs efficiently.
bulletpoints: Define the Laplace transform: \[ \mathcal{L}\{f(t)\} = \int_0^{\infty} e^{-st} f(t) dt \]
Solve ODEs by transforming them into algebraic equations in \( s \)-space.
Apply Laplace methods to step functions and impulse response problems.

cards.title: Fourier Series & PDE Solutions
cards.description: Expanding periodic functions into trigonometric series.
bulletpoints: Express a function \( f(x) \) as a Fourier series: \[ f(x) = a_0 + \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \left( a_n \cos(n\pi x) + b_n \sin(n\pi x) \right) \]
Calculate Fourier coefficients using integration over a period.
Apply Fourier series to solve boundary-value problems in physics and engineering.

cards.title: Power Series & Taylor Series
cards.description: Understanding how infinite series approximate functions and solve differential equations.
bulletpoints: Expand a function in a Taylor series about \( x=a \): \[ f(x) = \sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \frac{f^{(n)}(a)}{n!} (x - a)^n \]
Use power series methods to solve ODEs near ordinary points.
Determine the radius of convergence using the ratio test.

cards.title: Bessel Functions & Special Solutions
cards.description: Studying Bessel’s equation and its applications in physics.
bulletpoints: Solve Bessel’s differential equation: \[ x^2 y'' + x y' + (x^2 - n^2)y = 0 \]
Define Bessel functions of the first and second kind: \( J_n(x) \) and \( Y_n(x) \)
Apply Bessel functions to wave equations, heat conduction, and vibration problems.

cards.title: Legendre Polynomials & Orthogonal Functions
cards.description: Solving Legendre’s equation and applying orthogonal polynomials.
bulletpoints: Solve Legendre’s differential equation: \[ (1-x^2) y'' - 2x y' + n(n+1)y = 0 \]
Generate Legendre polynomials \( P_n(x) \) using Rodrigues’ formula.
Use Legendre functions in potential theory and spherical harmonics.

cards.title: Series Solutions of Differential Equations
cards.description: Solving ODEs using Frobenius and power series methods.
bulletpoints: Use Frobenius’ method for singular points: \[ y(x) = \sum_{n=0}^{\infty} a_n x^{n+r} \]
Determine indicial roots from the lowest-order term.
Apply series solutions to Bessel and Legendre equations.

cards.title: Nonlinear Differential Equations
cards.description: Exploring methods for solving nonlinear ODEs.
bulletpoints: Identify autonomous nonlinear equations: \[ \frac{dx}{dt} = f(x) \]
Use phase plane analysis to study stability and equilibrium points.
Apply perturbation methods to approximate solutions.

cards.title: Chaos Theory & Differential Equations
cards.description: Understanding how differential equations model chaotic systems.
bulletpoints: Define a chaotic system using sensitive dependence on initial conditions.
Analyze the Lorenz system equations: \[ \frac{dx}{dt} = \sigma(y - x), \quad \frac{dy}{dt} = x(\rho - z) - y, \quad \frac{dz}{dt} = xy - \beta z \]
Explore chaotic attractors and fractal geometry in dynamical systems.
